page.title: 07MILK HAS GOT A LOT OF BOTTLE
page.content: A typical modern farm is one like{Tal {Y Bryn}with its intensive farming.On this 20 hectar farm Mr & Mrs Roberts keep 50 fresian cross holstein cows. Eight cows are milked at the same time in the milkimg parlour and the milk goes straight from the cow along the pipes to the dairy.It is then cooled before it goes into the bulk tank.On most farms the story ends when the tanker comes for the milk,but at Tal Y Bryn they bottle the milk themselves. The milk flows from the tank through the pasteuriser into the bottles.Twice a week the milk is put through the separator to produce cream and skimmed milk,some of which is used to make yogurt and buttermilk.These are then sold as{Llaeth Y Llan}products.In July 1985 milk is 23p a bottle,skimmed milk is 20p,buttermilk is 20p a carton and yogurt is 18p a pot.
